entry.et: Middle English requeste, from Anglo-French, from Vulgar Latin *requaesta, from feminine of requaestus, past participle of requaerere to require

def.dt: :the act or an instance of asking for something
:the condition or fact of being requested available on request
:to make a request to or of requested her to write a paper
:to ask as a favor or privilege requests to be excused
:to ask (a person) to come or go to a thing or place
:to ask for requested a brief delay
